definitions: person who releases others from captivity, oppression, or control
examples: The liberator led the prisoners to freedom through the jungle
Many saw him as a liberator who broke the chains of tyranny

definitions: person who believes in maximum individual liberty and minimal government intervention
examples: The libertarian argued against new regulations at the town meeting
She identified as a libertarian who valued personal freedom above all

definitions: political philosophy advocating maximum individual freedom and minimal government control over personal and economic matters
examples: Libertarianism emphasizes personal responsibility and free market economics
The professor explained libertarianism as a philosophy that values individual choice

definitions: person's overall sexual drive or desire for sexual activity
examples: Stress and fatigue can significantly affect a person's libido
The medication listed decreased libido as a possible side effect

definitions: trained professional who manages library resources and assists people with research
examples: The librarian helped me find sources for my research paper
Our school librarian organizes reading programs for students every month

definitions: written text of an opera or other long vocal musical work
examples: The composer worked closely with the writer to perfect the libretto
She studied the Italian libretto before attending the opera performance

definitions: official document giving permission to own or do something specific
freedom to act or behave in a particular way
examples: He renewed his driving licence at the motor vehicle department
The restaurant applied for a licence to serve alcoholic beverages
The poet took artistic licence with the historical facts
Children need boundaries, not complete licence to do whatever they want

definitions: person or organization that holds a licence to do something
examples: The licensee must comply with all regulations to maintain their permit
Each licensee received updated guidelines about the new requirements

definitions: composite organism consisting of fungus and algae growing together on surfaces
examples: Colorful lichen covered the old stone wall in patches
The biologist studied how lichen survives in extreme Arctic conditions

definitions: act of passing the tongue over something
very small amount or trace of something
examples: The cat gave her kitten a gentle lick on the head
One lick of the ice cream cone made the child smile
There wasn't a lick of truth in his elaborate story
We need to add just a lick of paint to finish

definitions: action of using the tongue to touch or taste something
thorough defeat or physical beating
examples: The puppy's constant licking showed affection for its owner
The licking of stamps is no longer necessary with self-adhesive ones
Our team took a real licking in yesterday's championship game
He got a licking from his older brother for breaking the window

definitions: plant root used as flavoring in candy and medicine with distinctive sweet taste
examples: Black licorice candy has a strong, distinctive flavor many people love
The medicine contained licorice extract to improve its taste

definitions: removable or hinged cover for the top of a container
examples: She twisted the lid off the jar to get the cookies
The pot lid rattled as the water inside began to boil

definitions: legal right to keep possession of property belonging to another person until debt is paid
examples: The contractor placed a lien on the house for unpaid work
The bank's lien prevented him from selling the property

definitions: the place of something or someone, used in phrase 'in lieu of'
examples: She took time off in lieu of overtime payment
They offered stock options in lieu of a salary increase

definitions: specially constructed boat for emergency evacuation from a ship
examples: The cruise ship carried enough lifeboats for all passengers and crew
They lowered the lifeboat into the rough seas during the drill

definitions: trained person employed to rescue swimmers in danger and enforce safety rules
examples: The lifeguard blew her whistle to warn about dangerous currents
Beach lifeguards must pass rigorous swimming and first aid tests

definitions: rope or line used for life-saving, especially at sea
thing that provides crucial support or help in difficult times
examples: The sailor grabbed the lifeline as waves crashed over the deck
Rescue workers threw a lifeline to the stranded hikers
The food bank became a lifeline for struggling families
Her weekly phone calls were his lifeline during isolation

definitions: action or practice of saving people from drowning or other life-threatening situations
examples: She took a lifesaving course to become a better swimmer
The doctor's quick lifesaving actions prevented a tragedy

definitions: length of time that a person, animal, or thing exists or functions
examples: The average human lifespan has increased dramatically over centuries
This battery has a lifespan of approximately five years

definitions: person who lifts heavy weights as exercise or sport
mechanical device used to raise or lift objects
examples: The weight lifter trained six days a week for competitions
Professional lifters must use proper form to avoid injury
The mechanic used a hydraulic lifter to raise the engine
This valve lifter needs replacement to fix the ticking noise

definitions: moment when a rocket or spacecraft leaves the ground at launch
examples: The crowd counted down to liftoff of the space shuttle
Mission control confirmed successful liftoff at exactly noon

definitions: tough band of tissue connecting bones or holding organs in place
examples: The athlete tore a ligament in her knee during the game
Ligaments provide stability to joints throughout the body

definitions: process of making or becoming lighter in weight, color, or mood
examples: The lightening of her hair took several salon sessions
We noticed a gradual lightening of the sky before dawn

definitions: small device producing flame for lighting cigarettes or fires
flat-bottomed boat used to transfer cargo to and from ships
examples: He flicked the lighter to check if it still had fluid
She always carried a lighter for camping emergencies
The lighter transported containers from ship to shore
Several lighters worked to unload the massive cargo vessel

definitions: tower with bright light to warn or guide ships at sea
examples: The old lighthouse still guides boats safely through the rocky channel
They climbed to the top of the lighthouse for a panoramic view

definitions: arrangement of lights to illuminate a space or achieve particular effects
examples: The theater's lighting created a dramatic atmosphere for the play
Good lighting is essential for a productive work environment

definitions: boxer or wrestler in a specific lower weight class
person or thing of little importance or substance
examples: The lightweight boxer weighed in just under the limit
She competed as a lightweight throughout her wrestling career
Critics dismissed him as an intellectual lightweight
This laptop is a lightweight compared to older models

definitions: act of comparing one thing to another to show similarity
examples: His likening of the situation to a chess game helped explain it
The poet's likening of love to fire was particularly vivid

definitions: feeling of enjoying or being pleased by someone or something
examples: She developed a liking for classical music in college
His liking for spicy food grew during his travels

definitions: shrub with fragrant purple, pink, or white flower clusters
pale purple color like that of lilac flowers
examples: The lilac bushes bloom beautifully in late spring
She planted a lilac near her bedroom window for the scent
The bridesmaid dresses were a lovely shade of lilac
He painted the nursery walls in soft lilac

definitions: plant with large trumpet-shaped flowers growing from bulbs
examples: White lilies decorated the church for the wedding ceremony
The pond was covered with beautiful water lilies

definitions: uncertain period of waiting or transition between states
dance where people bend backwards to pass under a horizontal bar
examples: The project remained in limbo while awaiting funding approval
Their relationship was in limbo after the argument
The children laughed as they played limbo at the party
She won the limbo contest by bending incredibly low

definitions: small green citrus fruit with acidic juice
white caustic alkaline substance consisting of calcium oxide
examples: She squeezed fresh lime juice into the coconut water
The recipe calls for the zest of one lime
Farmers spread lime on fields to reduce soil acidity
The builders mixed lime into the mortar

definitions: focus of public attention or prominence
examples: The young actor suddenly found herself in the limelight
He preferred to avoid the limelight and work behind the scenes

definitions: humorous five-line poem with specific rhythm and rhyme scheme
examples: The children giggled at the silly limerick about a cat
He wrote a limerick for each guest at the party

definitions: sedimentary rock composed mainly of calcium carbonate from marine organisms
examples: The ancient pyramids were built using massive limestone blocks
Limestone cliffs rose dramatically from the ocean

definitions: device or mechanism that prevents something from exceeding a set limit
examples: The speed limiter prevented the car from exceeding safe speeds
Audio engineers use limiters to prevent signal distortion

definitions: action of setting restrictions or boundaries on something
examples: The limiting of screen time helped improve children's sleep
Budget limiting forced them to make difficult choices

definitions: informal term for limousine, a large luxury car
examples: The wedding party arrived at the church in a white limo
They hired a limo for their prom night celebration

definitions: large, luxurious car often with a partition between driver and passengers
examples: The celebrity stepped out of the black limousine onto the red carpet
The airport limousine service provided comfortable transportation

definitions: way of walking with difficulty due to injured leg or foot
examples: His limp became more noticeable when he was tired
The dog's limp worried us enough to visit the vet

definitions: action of walking with difficulty favoring one leg over another
examples: The limping player was helped off the field by teammates
Her limping gradually improved with physical therapy

definitions: deciduous tree with heart-shaped leaves and fragrant yellowish flowers
examples: The old linden tree provided shade for the entire courtyard
Linden trees lined both sides of the historic avenue

definitions: direct descent from an ancestor; ancestry or pedigree
examples: She traced her lineage back to colonial times
The horse's impressive lineage included several champions

definitions: quality of being arranged in or extending along a straight line
examples: The linearity of the design created a modern, minimalist look
Scientists studied the linearity of the relationship between variables

definitions: defensive player in American football positioned behind the line of scrimmage
examples: The linebacker made a crucial tackle to stop the touchdown
He played linebacker throughout his college football career

definitions: football player positioned on the line of scrimmage
worker who installs or repairs electrical or telephone lines
examples: The offensive lineman protected the quarterback from being sacked
Each lineman must master complex blocking techniques
The lineman worked through the storm to restore power
Experienced linemen climbed the poles to fix damaged cables
